This was actually such an interesting game! Short, sweet and very imaginatively designed, which also shared some striking similarities to Alice: Madness Returns, particularly with the unique combination of dream-like visuals, suspenseful ambience and uncanny character models. I really dig the art-style of these types of games, and can't wait to discover more games of a similar aesthetic.

In conclusion, I loved it. For what it's worth, I do wish it was a little longer, but I'm really excited to try Little Nightmares II and discover what unnerving things are waiting to be beheld. Recommended, I strongly suggest this game to anyone who's into Alice in Wonderland inspired games. You won't be let down :)

"Little Nightmares" is such an "out of the box" experience. I don't know how to describe this GEM, this game is so CREEPY and CUTE at the same time. It's insane how these developers were able to tread that fine line so well, it paid off. I love the designs on all of the people and monsters in this game, the DLC "The Deeps" is definitely a treat for those with thalassophobia. This game definitely made my skin crawl! I loved every minute of the "close calls". Little Nightmares is a pretty short game in all fairness, it's about 3 hours (if you don't get too caught up on the puzzles).


The puzzles in this game are fun but some of them are tedious to be honest. None of them are mind bending or anything like that, everything you need is in the room that you're locked in. However, sometimes not everything is so well explained so you're lost trying to obtain the resolution for the puzzle you're spending 30+ mins on... ( yes that was me... TWICE). The controls are simple but JANKY at times. I did not enjoy the controls too much but the game wasn't that long... 


All in all, I would recommend this game to the most casual gamer, it's a fun linear game  filled with obstacles,creepy visuals and some puzzles in it. 

8/10 - Wish it was longer (DLC MADE UP FOR IT)

The levels are well-designed, and the game tells its story through its world, not words, which makes it feel special. It‚Äôs quite short sadly (about 4-6 hours), but still REALLY fun.

If you like creepy, tense games, Little Nightmares is definitely worth playing!!!
